basics.name: Fatemeh Pouryahya
basics.label: Student
basics.summary:
Hi! I am a master’s student with concentration in statistics in the mathematics and statistics department at University of Ottawa. My research interest revolve around mathematical, computational and data analytic problems with biological and biomedical implications. I am currently doing research in computational comparative genomics at David Sankoff’s lab. 
Previously, I worked as an accounting expert in couple of industries, and I received my bachelor’s degree with concentration in applied mathematics in the mathematics, statistics, and computer science department at University of Tehran.

education.area: Mathematics and Statistics, concentration in Statistics

Relevant Courses.area: Statistical Machine Learning, Mathematical genomics, Discrete Applied Math I, Stochastic Analysis, Analysis of Categorical data, Cryptography

Bioinformatics, Advanced Programming, Data Structure, Graph Theory, Combinatorics, Foundation
of Probability, Probability I and II, Linear Optimization I and II, Numerical Linear Algebra, Numerical Analysis, Nonlinear Optimization, Differential Equations, Matrices and Linear Algebra, Economics, Strategic games, Dynamical systems, Differential Analysis, Topology

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.
